channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Survivors of Bus Crash Near Buffalo Recount Harrowing Ordeal
item.description: The crash of the tour bus, which was headed from Niagara Falls to New York City on Friday, left five dead. Their names were released by the authoritie...

item.title: Faced With Trump’s English Mandate, Mexico’s Truckers Report to Class
item.description: Companies, fearing penalties that could put them out of business, race to make sure their drivers have enough English to communicate with U.S. officia...

item.title: Trump halts work on an offshore wind project that’s 80% complete, citing unspecified ‘national security interests’
item.description: Revolution Wind was expected to be Rhode Island and Connecticut’s first commercial-scale offshore wind farm, capable of powering more than 350,000 hom...

item.title: Why banks should leverage AI to serve more than the affluent—and build a financial system for everyone
item.description: Around one billion people still lack access to formal financial systems. AI can help close the gap—in part by allowing for collateral-free lending.

item.title: Faced With Trump’s English Mandate, Mexico’s Truckers Report to Class
item.description: Companies, fearing penalties that could put them out of business, race to make sure their drivers have enough English to communicate with U.S. officia...

item.title: A Muted Homecoming for Kilmar Abrego Garcia
item.description: Mr. Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully deported to El Salvador, is keeping a low profile as his lawyers prepare to fight the Trump administration’s pro...

item.title: What the U.S. Open Tells Us About America
item.description: Tennis can teach us lessons about how America can be first while also staying open to the world.

item.title: A duty-free exemption is about to expire amid Trump’s trade war. So postal services across Europe will halt shipments to the U.S.
item.description: The exemption, known as the “de minimis" exemption, allows packages worth less than $800 to come into the U.S. duty free.

item.title: Fed Officials Try to Keep Focus on Economy as Trump Intensifies Attacks
item.description: The administration’s effort to oust a Fed governor as part of a pressure campaign for lower borrowing costs created an inescapable distraction at this...

item.title: Russia is ‘teetering on the brink of a recession’ and headed for a disastrous harvest, while Putin’s other top source of cash plunges
item.description: "We also think there's a significant probability of Russia's economy slipping into a technical recession in the coming quarters."

item.title: The Fed is starting to worry about the housing market now
item.description: "A few participants noted a weakening in housing demand, with increased availability of homes for sale and falling house prices."

item.title: The Water Cure
item.description: Whether you swim furiously or float motionless, being in the water is a magical feeling.

item.title: Collapse of Bridge Under Construction in China Leaves 12 Dead
item.description: A section of the railway bridge, under construction in the country’s northwest, plunged into the Yellow River early on Friday.

item.title: An Unusual Sight Over Canada’s Arctic: Wildfire Smoke
item.description: Once rare, wildfire smoke is becoming more prevalent in Arctic communities as Canada faces harsh wildfire seasons.

item.title: After Gaza Famine Report, U.S. Is Mostly Silent and Israel Defiant
item.description: The White House has not commented on a report finding famine in Gaza. Analysts say that absent U.S. pressure, Israel is unlikely to change course.
